thread.title: Amit Mishra wasn’t in the room during alleged assault: reports
thread.title_full: Amit Mishra wasn’t in the room during alleged assault: reports

author: Deccan
title: Amit Mishra wasn’t in the room during alleged assault: reports
text:
Deccan Chronicle/PTI | October 21, 2015, 19.41 pm According to the FIR, the woman pointed out that Mishra assaulted her in his room on September 25 and hit her with his fists and threw a kettle at her face. (Photo: AP/PTI) Bengaluru: Team India cricketer Amit Mishra was on Tuesday summoned by the city police after he was booked for allegedly physically assaulting and abusing a woman in his hotel room here last month. But now according to a leading television channel on Wednesday, Mishra wasn’t in the hotel room at the time the woman alleged he assaulted him, a source close to the cricketer said.
“She is not his girlfriend. He (Amit Mishra) didn’t even know that she was in his room. She picked up the access card from the hotel staff and entered the room without Amit’s knowledge,” the source claimed.
“The time she has claimed to have been assaulted by Amit, he had gone out to have dinner with friends. Then how can he abuse or assault her. There was no fight. He didn’t assault her,” he added.
Read: Amit Mishra to 'co-operate' with police after ODI series, says his brother
According to the FIR, the woman pointed out that Mishra assaulted her in his room on September 25 and hit her with his fists and threw a kettle at her face.
"We have shot off a notice, summoning India cricketer Amit Mishra for allegedly physically assaulting and physically abusing a woman in his hotel room last month, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Central, Sandeep Patil told reporters.
According to the sources, Mishra has "agreed" to co-operate with the investigations and will appear before the police after the Mumbai ODI against South Africa is played on October 25. His teammate Harbhajan Singh also said the 32-year-old from New Delhi will be available for selection if needed during the fourth ODI in Chennai on Thursday.
 Cricket Team India Amit Mishra Bengaluru Police FIR Also Read Team India’s Amit Mishra booked for assaulting woman in hotel Amit Mishra to 'co-operate' with police after ODI series, says his brother I don't think if I am in the team or not: Amit Mishra Video: Amit Mishra keen to seal ODI spot
